messages.title: NHS Funding
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats have pledged an extra £8 billion a year for our NHS by 2020, in line with what the Chief Executive of NHS England says is needed.

messages.title: Mental Health
messages.content: Mental health should be taken as seriously as physical health. We've introduced the first ever cap on care costs to protect people in old age.

messages.title: Child Mental Health
messages.content: We've just announced £1.25 billion of new funding for children's mental health services.

messages.title: Labour's NHS Record
messages.content: Contrasts Liberal Democrat actions with Labour's record, critiquing Labour's approach to NHS management and outsourcing.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pledge an extra £8 billion a year for the NHS by 2020.
Take mental health as seriously as physical health; introduced cap on care costs.
Announced £1.25 billion of new funding for children's mental health services.

issues.health: Committed to NHS funding and improvement; contrasted with Labour's past management.

leaflet.personalStatement: As Lib Dem Minister of State for Care and Support, emphasizes commitment to NHS funding, protection, and improvements.

politicalExperience.role: Lib Dem Minister of State for Care and Support
politicalExperience.achievements: Secured extra £2 billion investment in the NHS; announced new funding for children's mental health services.

quotes.text: The Liberal Democrats don't just talk the talk. We campaigned to secure an extra £2 billion investment in the NHS this year to keep standards high.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet contrasts Liberal Democrat commitments with Labour's past record on managing the NHS, advocating for improvements and protection of the health service.
